dmca.title: DMCA (Copyright) Complaint to Google
dmca.body:
Hi Sarah & u2u-legal-escalations!

We ran into http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Webmasters/thread?tid=63bddd764429c655&hl=en
in the forums. It's basically a thread by someone who's complaining
that someone is removing their posts to the newsgroup
alt.fan.adolf-hitler.

It's off-topic to the webmasters forum, but given that there's no
Google Groups forum, I guess the chit-chat sub-forum is as good as
any... However, how much of this thread should we remove or lock or
ignore?

The initial post is clean enough:
I post on alt.fan.adolf-hitler. Beginning yesterday, all my posts are
being deleted by Google. Why?
When I post on the site, I always get a verification of my post in my
inbox.  However, my post does not appear on alt.fan.adolf-hitler.
Obviously this is being done by Google.  Why?

but some of the follow-ups are a bad:
That just doesn't make sense.  Jews go onto that particular forum and
post porn all the time. Google doesn't seem to care about that.
Unless of course, Google is owned by Jews.  Could that be the case?

Also, the user's profile uses a swastika:
https://profiles.google.com/114977325947981171101/posts?hl=en

Thoughts? I assume just removing the problematic posts is enough,
right? or do we need to do more here?

Thanks!
John

-- 
John Mueller - go/wta
Google Switzerland GmbH
Want to post in the forums? go/help-webmasters
